title: About
text: I’m Grace Remus, a senior studying Sports Media and Mass Communications with a minor in English at the University of Nebraska–Lincoln. My work here has focused on finding new and creative ways to tell stories from the world of sports. Whether it’s through data visualization, design, or written storytelling, I aim to uncover new perspectives and help audiences see the game in a deeper, more meaningful way.

title: How Important are Kickers in Securing Wins?
text:
Are kickers the most important part of a football team? How much do their points matter to a teams’ result


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.2
✔ ggplot2   4.0.0     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
X2024KICKING <- read_csv("data/2024KICKING.csv") |>
  mutate(Team = case_when(
    Team == "DAL" ~ "Dallas Cowboys",
    Team == "PIT" ~ "Pittsburgh Steelers",
    Team == "LAC" ~ "Los Angeles Chargers",
    Team == "HOU" ~ "Houston Texans",
    Team == "MIA" ~ "Miami Dolphins",
    Team == "LVR" ~ "Las Vegas Raiders",
    Team == "IND" ~ "Indianapolis Colts",
    Team == "PHI" ~ "Philadelphia Eagles",
    Team == "LAR" ~ "Los Angeles Rams",
    Team == "ATL" ~ "Atlanta Falcons",
    Team == "DEN" ~ "Denver Broncos",
    Team == "SFO" ~ "San Francisco 49ers",
    Team == "NWE" ~ "New England Patriots",
    Team == "TAM" ~ "Tampa Bay Buccaneers",
    Team == "ARI" ~ "Arizona Cardinals",
    Team == "NOR" ~ "New Orleans Saints",
    Team == "SEA" ~ "Seattle Seahawks",
    Team == "MIN" ~ "Minnesota Vikings",
    Team == "WAS" ~ "Washington Commanders",
    Team == "BAL" ~ "Baltimore Ravens",
    Team == "BUF" ~ "Buffalo Bills",
    Team == "DET" ~ "Detroit Lions",
    Team == "JAX" ~ "Jacksonville Jaguars",
    Team == "CLE" ~ "Cleveland Browns",
    Team == "CAR" ~ "Carolina Panthers",
    Team == "KAN" ~ "Kansas City Chiefs",
    Team == "CHI" ~ "Chicago Bears",
    Team == "TEN" ~ "Tennessee Titans",
    Team == "CIN" ~ "Cincinnati Bengals",
    Team == "GNB" ~ "Green Bay Packers",
    Team == "NYG" ~ "New York Giants",
    Team == "NYJ" ~ "New York Jets"))


Rows: 81 Columns: 31
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (5): Player, Team, Pos, Awards, -9999
dbl (26): Rk, Age, G, GS, FGA_0-19, FGM_0-19, FGA_20-29, FGM_20-29, FGA_30-3...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
afc_2024 <- read_csv("data/2024AFC.csv")


Rows: 16 Columns: 12
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Tm
dbl (11): W, L, W-L%, TeamPts, OppPts, PD, MoV, SoS, SRS, OSRS, DSRS

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
nfc_2024 <- read_csv("data/2024NFC.csv")


Rows: 16 Columns: 12
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Tm
dbl (11): W, L, W-L%, TeamPts, OppPts, PD, MoV, SoS, SRS, OSRS, DSRS

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
colnames(afc_2024)[colnames(afc_2024) == "Tm"] <- "Team"
colnames(nfc_2024)[colnames(nfc_2024) == "Tm"] <- "Team"
afc_2024 <- afc_2024 |>
  mutate(Team = gsub("[*+]", "", Team) |> trimws())

nfc_2024 <- nfc_2024 |>
  mutate(Team = gsub("[*+]", "", Team) |> trimws())
afc_nfc_data <- bind_rows(afc_2024, nfc_2024)
nfl_kicking_2024 <- left_join(X2024KICKING,afc_nfc_data, by = "Team") |> select(`Team`, `Player`, `FG%`, `W-L%`)


Warning in left_join(X2024KICKING, afc_nfc_data, by = "Team"): Detected an unexpected many-to-many relationship between `x` and `y`.
ℹ Row 1 of `x` matches multiple rows in `y`.
ℹ Row 7 of `y` matches multiple rows in `x`.
ℹ If a many-to-many relationship is expected, set `relationship =
  "many-to-many"` to silence this warning.


Code
ggplot(nfl_kicking_2024, aes(x = `FG%`, y = `W-L%`)) +
  geom_point(color = "indianred") +
  labs(
    x = "Field Goal Percentage",
    y = "Win-Loss Percentage",
    title = "Field Goal Percentage compared to Win-Loss Percentage"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()


Warning: Removed 65 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).









This graph shows that good kickers may not necessarily make a great team, now lets look at how many point those kickers are actually responsible for.
